data.Sentence_cn: 消防队员们终于扑灭了加利福尼亚的一场森林大火。
data.Sentence: At last firemen have put out a big forest fire in California.

data.Sentence_cn: 从那时起，他们一直试图找出起火的原因。
data.Sentence: Since then, they have been trying to find out how the fire began.

data.Sentence_cn: 森林火灾时常由破碎的玻璃或人们随手扔掉的香烟头引起。
data.Sentence: Forest fires are often caused by broken glass or by cigarette ends which people carelessly throw away.

data.Sentence_cn: 昨天，消防队员仔细查看了地面，但未能发现碎玻璃。
data.Sentence: Yesterday the firemen examined the ground carefully, but were not able to find any broken glass.

data.Sentence_cn: 他们还十分肯定火灾也不是由烟头引起的。
data.Sentence: They were also quite sure that a cigarette end did not start the fire.

data.Sentence_cn: 然而今天上午，一个消防队员偶然发现了起火的原因。
data.Sentence: This morning, however, a firemen accidentally discovered the cause.

data.Sentence_cn: 他发现了缠绕在16,000伏高压线上的一条死蛇。
data.Sentence: He noticed the remains of a snake which was wound round the electric wires of a 16,000-volt power line.

data.Sentence_cn: 就这样，他解开了起火之谜。
data.Sentence: In this way, he was able to solve the mystery.

data.Sentence_cn: 解释很简单，却异乎寻常。
data.Sentence: The explanation was simple but very unusual.

data.Sentence_cn: 一只鸟把蛇从地上抓起来，然后把它扔到了电线上。
data.Sentence: A bird had snatched up the snake from the ground and then dropped it on to the wires.

data.Sentence_cn: 于是蛇就缠住了几根电线。
data.Sentence: The snake then wound itself round the wires.

data.Sentence_cn: 当它这样做时，把火花送到了地面，这些火花立刻引起了一场大火。
data.Sentence: When it did so, it sent sparks down to the ground and these immediately started a fire.
